required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: MK-1006 Single Dose Study in Japanese Type 2 Diabetes Patients (MK-1006-005)
clinical_study.official_title: A Single Dose Clinical Trial to Study the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacodynamics, and Pharmacokinetics of MK-1006 in Japanese Subject With Type 2 Diabetes

brief_summary.textblock: A single rising dose study to assess the safety, tolerability, pharmacokinetics and pharmacodynamics of MK-1006 in Japanese participants with Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus (T2DM). The primary hypothesis of the study is that single doses of MK-1006 will be sufficiently safe and well tolerated, based on the assessment of clinical and laboratory evaluations and adverse experiences, in Japanese participants with T2DM.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Experienced at Least One Adverse Event
primary_outcome.time_frame: from the time of the run-in period prior to the first dose of study drug through the end of the poststudy period (up to approximately 31 days)
primary_outcome.description: An adverse event is defined as any unfavorable and unintended change in the structure, function, or chemistry of the body temporally associated with the use of the study drug, whether or not considered related to the use of the product.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Discontinued Treatment Due to an Adverse Event
primary_outcome.description: An adverse event is defined as any unfavorable and unintended change in the structure, function, or chemistry of the body temporally associated with the use of the study drug, whether or not considered related to the use of the product.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Area Under the Plasma Concentration Curve From Time Zero to Infinity(AUC[0-∞]) After a Single Dose of MK-1006
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Approximately 96 hours for MK-1006 15mg, 30 mg, 45 mg, 60 mg, 60 mg fed (predose up to approximately 96 hours postdose); approximately 120 hours for MK-1006 80 mg, 100 mg, 140 mg, and 170 mg (predose up to 120 hours postdose)
secondary_outcome.description: AUC(0-∞) was estimated by determining the total area under the curve of the concentration versus time curve extrapolated to infinity. The placebo group was not evaluated for this outcome measure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Area Under the Plasma Concentration Curve From Time Zero to 24 Hours (AUC[0-24]) After a Single Dose of MK-1006
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Approximately 96 hours for MK-1006 15mg, 30 mg, 45 mg, 60 mg, 60 mg fed (predose up to approximately 96 hours postdose); approximately 120 hours for MK-1006 80 mg, 100 mg, 140 mg, and 170 mg (predose up to 120 hours postdose)
secondary_outcome.description: AUC(0 to 24 hours) was estimated by determining the total area under the curve of the concentration versus time curve to 24 hours post dose. The placebo group was not evaluated for this outcome measure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Maximum Plasma Concentration (Cmax) After a Single Dose of MK-1006
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Approximately 96 hours for MK-1006 15mg, 30 mg, 45 mg, 60 mg, 60 mg fed (predose up to approximately 96 hours postdose); approximately 120 hours for MK-1006 80 mg, 100 mg, 140 mg, and 170 mg (predose up to 120 hours postdose)
secondary_outcome.description: The placebo group was not evaluated for this outcome measure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Median Time to Maximum Plasma Concentration (Tmax) After a Single Dose of MK-1006
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Approximately 96 hours for MK-1006 15mg, 30 mg, 45 mg, 60 mg, 60 mg fed (predose up to approximately 96 hours postdose); approximately 120 hours for MK-1006 80 mg, 100 mg, 140 mg, and 170 mg (predose up to 120 hours postdose)
secondary_outcome.description: The placebo group was not evaluated for this outcome measure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Apparent Terminal Half-life (T 1/2) After a Single Dose of MK-1006
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Approximately 96 hours for MK-1006 15mg, 30 mg, 45 mg, 60 mg, 60 mg fed (predose up to approximately 96 hours postdose); approximately 120 hours for MK-1006 80 mg, 100 mg, 140 mg, and 170 mg (predose up to 120 hours postdose)
secondary_outcome.description: The apparent half-life was defined as the time required for the plasma concentration of MK-1006 to decrease 50% in the final stage of its elimination. The means and standard deviations displayed as are the harmonic means and pseudo-standard deviations, respectively. The placebo group was not evaluated for this outcome measure.
Weighted mean glucose concentration was calculated as the 24-hour area under the plasma concentration-time curve divided by 24.

arm_group.description: Participants received a single rising dose of MK-1006 (dosed at 15 mg, 30 mg, and 45 mg) or matching placebo to MK-1006 with a 7-day wash-out period between doses. Participants could have received both MK-1006 and matching placebo to MK-1006 over the 3 treatment periods.

Participants received a single rising dose of MK-1006 (dosed at 60 mg, 80 mg, and 60 mg fed state) or matching placebo to MK-1006 with a 7-day wash-out period between doses. Participants could have received both MK-1006 and matching placebo to MK-1006 over the 3 treatment periods.

Participants received a single rising dose of MK-1006 (dosed at 100 mg, 140 mg, and 170 mg) or matching placebo to MK-1006 with a 7-day wash-out period between doses. Participants could have received both MK-1006 and matching placebo to MK-1006 over the 3 treatment periods.

intervention.description: MK-1006 capsules in single oral doses beginning at 15 mg and rising to 45 mg in Panel A, beginning at 60 mg and rising to 80 mg and 60 mg fed state in Panel B, or beginning at 100 mg and rising to 170 mg in Panel C.
Matching placebo to MK-1006 in a single oral dose

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Japanese male or female between 20 to 64 years of age
- Diagnosis of type 2 diabetes
- Patient is being treated with diet and exercise alone or single oral anti-hyperglycemic agent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subject has a history of type 1 diabetes mellitus
- Subject has a clinical diagnosis of glaucoma
- Subject has donated blood or participated in another clinical study in the past 12 weeks
- Subject is a regular user of any illicit drugs or has a history of drug, including alcohol, abuse in the past 6 months

group.title: Panel A: MK-1006 15/30/45
group.description: Participants received a single dose of MK-1006 (dosed at 15 mg, 30 mg, and 45 mg) or matching placebo to MK-1006 with a 7-day wash-out period between doses. Participants could have received both MK-1006 and matching placebo to MK-1006 over the 3 treatment periods.

group.title: Panel B: MK-1006 60/80/60 Fed
group.description: Participants received a single dose of MK-1006 (dosed at 60 mg, 80 mg, and 60 mg fed state) or matching placebo to MK-1006 with a 7-day wash-out period between doses. Participants could have received both MK-1006 and matching placebo to MK-1006 over the 3 treatment periods.

group.title: Panel C: MK-1006 100/140/170
group.description: Participants received a single dose of MK-1006 (dosed at 100 mg, 140 mg, and 170 mg) or matching placebo to MK-1006 with a 7-day wash-out period between doses. Participants could have received both MK-1006 and matching placebo to MK-1006 over the 3 treatment periods.

group.title: Panel A: MK-1006 15/30/45
group.description: Participants received a single dose of MK-1006 (dosed at 15 mg, 30 mg, and 45 mg) or matching placebo to MK-1006 with a 7-day wash-out period between doses. Participants could have received both MK-1006 and matching placebo to MK-1006 over the 3 treatment periods.

group.title: Panel B: MK-1006 60/80/60 Fed
group.description: Participants received a single dose of MK-1006 (dosed at 60 mg, 80 mg, and 60 mg fed state) or matching placebo to MK-1006 with a 7-day wash-out period between doses. Participants could have received both MK-1006 and matching placebo to MK-1006 over the 3 treatment periods.

group.title: Panel C: MK-1006 100/140/170
group.description: Participants received a single dose of MK-1006 (dosed at 100 mg, 140 mg, and 170 mg) or matching placebo to MK-1006 with a 7-day wash-out period between doses. Participants could have received both MK-1006 and matching placebo to MK-1006 over the 3 treatment periods.

outcome.title: Mean Area Under the Plasma Concentration Curve From Time Zero to Infinity(AUC[0-∞]) After a Single Dose of MK-1006
outcome.description: AUC(0-∞) was estimated by determining the total area under the curve of the concentration versus time curve extrapolated to infinity. The placebo group was not evaluated for this outcome measure.
outcome.time_frame: Approximately 96 hours for MK-1006 15mg, 30 mg, 45 mg, 60 mg, 60 mg fed (predose up to approximately 96 hours postdose); approximately 120 hours for MK-1006 80 mg, 100 mg, 140 mg, and 170 mg (predose up to 120 hours postdose)
outcome.population: Participants received a singe dose of MK-1006 following an overnight fast (for approximately 10 hours), except the MK-1006 60 mg fed arm in which participants received a single dose of MK-1006 following the consumption of a standard Japanese breakfast. The same participant may appear in more than one treatment arm.

measure.title: 24-hour Weighted Mean Glucose (WMG) Concentration
measure.description: Weighted mean glucose concentration was calculated as the 24-hour area under the plasma concentration-time curve divided by 24.
measure.population: Participants received a singe dose of MK-1006 following an overnight fast (for approximately 10 hours), except the MK-1006 60 mg fed arm in which participants received a single dose of MK-1006 following the consumption of a standard Japanese breakfast. analysis.groups_desc: At one or more well tolerated single doses of MK-1006, the 24-hour weighted mean glucose concentration is expected to be at least 25 mg/dL lower than placebo.
analysis.p_value_desc: A step down procedure starting with the highest tolerated dose was implemented.
analysis.method_desc: Based on mixed effect model with glucose baseline, panel and treatment-within-panel as fixed effects and participant-within panel as a random effect.
analysis.estimate_desc: The calculation used to determine the difference in least squares mean (LS mean) was LS mean for MK-1006 15 mg minus LS mean for placebo.

analysis.groups_desc: At one or more well tolerated single doses of MK-1006, the 24-hour weighted mean glucose concentration is expected to be at least 25 mg/dL lower than placebo.
analysis.p_value_desc: A step down procedure starting with the highest tolerated dose was implemented.
analysis.method_desc: Based on mixed effect model with glucose baseline, panel and treatment-within-panel as fixed effects and participant-within panel as a random effect.

analysis.estimate_desc: The calculation used to determine the difference in least squares mean (LS mean) was LS mean for MK-1006 60 mg fed minus LS mean for placebo fed.

analysis.method_desc: Based on mixed effect model with glucose baseline, panel and treatment-within-panel as fixed effects and participant-within panel as a random effect.
analysis.estimate_desc: Difference in least squares mean (LS mean) was calculated as LS mean for MK-1006 60 mg minus LS mean for MK-1006 60 mg fed.

analysis.method_desc: Based on mixed effect model with glucose baseline, panel and treatment-within-panel as fixed effects and participant-within panel as a random effect.
analysis.estimate_desc: The calculation used to determine the difference in least squares mean (LS mean) was LS mean for placebo fed minus LS mean for placebo.

analysis.method_desc: Based on mixed effect model with glucose baseline, panel and treatment-within-panel as fixed effects and participant-within panel as a random effect.

group.title: MK-1006 15 mg
group.description: Participants received a single dose of MK-1006 15 mg

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The sponsor must have the opportunity to review all proposed abstracts, manuscripts, or presentations regarding this study 60 days prior to submission for publication/presentation. Any information identified by the sponsor as confidential must be deleted prior to submission.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Senior Vice President, Global Clinical Development
